question: Is vorinostat effective for glioblastoma?
ideal_answer: No. Although vorinostat is well tolerated it does not improve survival of glioblastoma patients.

snippets.text: Conclusions: Vorinostat combined with standard chemoradiation had acceptable tolerability in newly diagnosed glioblastoma. Although the primary efficacy endpoint was not met, vorinostat sensitivity and resistance signatures could facilitate patient selection in future trials.
LESSONS LEARNED: Combination regimen with bevacizumab (BEV) and vorinostat is well tolerated in patients with recurrent glioblastoma.
